sn23.1:4.2: Then Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha,
sn23.1:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn23.1:5.1: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘Māra’.
sn23.1:5.3: “When there is form, Rādha, there may be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.
sn23.1:5.4: So you should see form as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the abscess, the dart, the misery, the miserable.
sn23.1:5.5: Those who see it like this see rightly.
sn23.1:5.9: consciousness, there may be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.
sn23.1:5.10: So you should see consciousness as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the abscess, the dart, the misery, the miserable.
sn23.1:5.11: Those who see it like this see rightly.”
sn23.1:6.1: “But sir, what’s the purpose of seeing rightly?”
sn23.1:6.2: “Disillusionment is the purpose of seeing rightly.”
sn23.1:6.9: “But sir, what is the purpose of seeing extinguishment?”
sn23.1:6.10: “Your question goes too far, Rādha. You couldn’t figure out the limit of questions.
sn23.1:6.11: For extinguishment is the culmination, destination, and end of the spiritual life.”
